contextId.information: AT: "Other nations honored Jerusalem like they would honor the daughter of a king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: She was a princess among the nations

contextId.information: AT: "has sent a painful punishment into my inner being, and it has destroyed me" or "has sent a destructive punishment into the middle of Jerusalem, and it has destroyed the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: has sent fire into my bones, and it has conquered them

contextId.information: Here the judgment of God is described as if Jerusalem were grapes on which he had trampled in order to squeeze out the juice. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The Lord has trampled ... in the winepress

contextId.information: "disregarded," "paid no attention to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]).
contextId.quote: not remembered

contextId.information: Here "footstool" represents the place where God acts kindly enough to be present. Possible referents here are 1) "his beloved city of Jerusalem" or 2) "his covenant with Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]).
contextId.quote: his footstool

contextId.information: "completely destroyed" like an animal leaves nothing when he swallows food (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: swallowed up

contextId.information: The rod is a stick that people used to beat and punish someone. AT: "Because Yahweh is angrily beating me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: under the rod of Yahweh's fury

contextId.information: AT: "he has become my enemy" or "he uses his power to punish me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he turned his hand against me

contextId.information: Siege works are ramps of dirt that enable the attacking army to cross over the city walls and invade the city. AT: "He surrounded me as if I were a city under attack." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He built up siege works against me

contextId.information: "prevented me from escaping from him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: blocked my path

contextId.information: "It is as though he forced me to eat bitter herbs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He filled me with bitterness

contextId.information: Some versions translate, "My glory has perished," but here "glory" stands for endurance or strength. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: My endurance has perished

contextId.information: "To abuse" or "To kill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: To crush underfoot

contextId.information: AT: "You use the clouds as a shield to keep our prayers away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: You have covered yourself with a cloud so that no prayer can pass through

contextId.information: "Tears flow from my eyes like water flows in a river" because I am crying (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: My eyes flow with streams of tears

contextId.information: This presents a picture of a courtroom, where the speaker is on trial. In this picture, God argues for him, as a lawyer argues for his client. AT: "you argued for me in court" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you defended my case, you saved my life!

contextId.information: Possible meanings; 1) "Our leaders were previously beautiful to look at" (UDB) because they were physically healthy or 2) the people loved their leaders because the leaders were morally pure the way new snow and milk are pure white. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Her leaders were purer than snow, whiter than milk

contextId.information: This is a title for the king, who provides life to his people like breath keeps the body alive. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The breath in our nostrils

contextId.information: The wine that people will drink from the cup is a symbol of Yahweh's anger. AT: "Yahweh will also judge you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to you also the cup will be passed

contextId.information: The people of Jerusalem have no one to protect them because the men have either died in battle or have gone into exile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: We have become orphans ... our mothers are like widows
